channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Meta's Ad Strength Gives Its AI Spending Some Cover
item.description: The Facebook parent is the latest to signal more capital spending ahead, but advertising is holding up.

item.title: Biogen beats expectations, hikes outlook as Alzheimer's drug Leqembi and other new products gain traction
item.description: Uptake of Biogen's breakthrough Alzheimer's drug, Leqembi, appears to be picking up, with roughly $40 million in sales for the quarter.

item.title: Why the Fed Risks Falling Behind
item.description: Waiting until September to start cutting rates might have narrowed the Federal Reserve’s room for maneuver.

item.title: Wayfair CEO likens home goods slowdown to 2008 financial crisis: 'Customers remain cautious'
item.description: Online home goods company Wayfair has seen sluggish demand against high interest rates, but repreive could come if the federal reserve cuts rates in September

item.title: Umbrella Insurance Covers Worst-Case Scenarios. There Are Now More of Them.
item.description: While insurance premiums surged with inflation, coverage limits haven’t.

item.title: Moderna stock falls more than 10% as it slashes guidance on low EU sales, tough U.S. vaccine market
item.description: Moderna now expects 2024 product revenue to come in between $3 billion and $3.5 billion, down from a previous guidance of $4 billion.

item.title: Stocks, Bonds Climb After Fed Meeting
item.description: The Nasdaq, S&P 500 and government bonds rallied on the final day of July, capping a topsy-turvy month for global markets.

item.title: Shell beats second-quarter profit expectations, launches $3.5 billion share buyback program
item.description: Shell on Thursday posted stronger-than-expected second-quarter profit after issuing a warning over lower fossil fuel prices and refining margins.

item.title: Bill Ackman Pulls Investment Fund IPO After Shrinking Its Size
item.description: The billionaire investor originally aimed to raise $25 billion in the offering before lowering the target to around $2 billion this week.

item.title: Barclays profit dips in the second quarter, beats estimates
item.description: The British lender is undergoing a major restructuring program in a bid to boost profits.
